intro: Endostemon angolensis, commonly known as the Angola endostemon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of yellow or white. Endostemon angolensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid environments.
